intro: Misopates marraicum, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a strong, sweet fragrance. The plant belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in arid conditions. Its leaves are broad and succulent, adapted to store water, while its stems are woody and often branched. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hard seeds.
